pr_title: Fix RedisClientName and MongoClientName can't be applied to parameters

timeline.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText:
We need @mkouba opinion. The last time I used a qualifier, I heard him shouting at me and I'm living more than 1000 km away from him :-)
It seems ok here, but better check.
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Hmm, this is OK. This is what we use everywhere for named whatever.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: This should be fine as the annotation is used as a CDI qualifier (@cescoffier do you spot the difference? Also I don't remember this incident and BTW you live approx. 1000km away from me, or? ;-)
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: I would add a specific test rather than fiddling with an existing one.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: I've changed it the way @cescoffier suggested here #12902 (comment) with constructor and field injection.
replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText:
It's really better to add an entirely separate test, testing both clients for each injection type.
Just copy/paste the existing one and change the injection.
replies.author: gsmet

timeline.message:
fix(redis): @RedisClientName can't be applied to parameters

Fixes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/12898

fix(redis): @RedisClientName can't be applied to parameters

Fixes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/12898
fix(mongo): mongoClientName can't be applied to parameters
fix(mongo): mongoClientName can't be applied to parameters
